metadata.title: CVE-2024-50218 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ocfs2: pass u64 to ocfs2_truncate_inline maybe overflowSyzbot reported a kernel BUG in ocfs2_truncate_inline.  There are tworeasons for this: first, the parameter value passed is greater thanocfs2_max_inline_data_with_xattr, second, the start and end parameters ofocfs2_truncate_inline are "unsigned int".So, we need to add a sanity check for byte_start and byte_len right beforeocfs2_truncate_inline() in ocfs2_remove_inode_range(), if they are greaterthan ocfs2_max_inline_data_with_xattr return -EINVAL.
